title.narrative: Water Supply and Sanitation Sector Project - Additional Financing

description.narrative: The additional financing will (i) rehabilitate and upgrade water supply infrastructure, (ii) improve the performance of water services, and (iii) improve the management and operational efficiency of the water utility company.2 Also, the additional financing will ensure further public health and environmental improvements by providing potable and reliable water supply to households in approximately 18 towns and 92 villages in the provinces of Aragatsotn, Ararat, Amavir, Geharqunik, Tavush, Lori, Kotayq, Shirak, Syunik, and Vayotz-Dzor. The Asian Development Bank (ADB) loan will form part of a larger sector capital investment by the government of Armenia and other international financial institutions including the World Bank and the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: Improved access to safe, reliable, and sustainable WSS in about 29 towns and up to 160 project villages, managed on commercial principles and with environmentally sound practices

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

About 700,000 residents in the project towns and villages directly or indirectly benefit by 2017 from reliable supplies of potable water for at least 15 hours per day that meets Armenian water quality standards.

description.narrative: Improved access to safe, reliable, and sustainable WSS in about 29 towns and up to 160 project villages, managed on commercial principles and with environmentally sound practices

title.narrative: The technical, financial, and managerial capacity of the AWSC is further improved by 2017.
